title: Ju Dou
creator_credit: Zhi-an Zhang, Xia Rujin, Cao Juiping, Hu Jian, Liu Heng, Wenze Zhang, Yasuyoshi Tokuma, Zhang Yimou and China Film Co-Production Corporation
brief_description: Zhang Yimou’s Ju Dou is the first Chinese film to be nominated for an Academy Award for Best Foreign Language film. Starring Gong Li as a young woman trapped in a loveless marriage, this sensual and striking film is aided by its vivid use of Technicolor.

constellations_other.name: Evolution of colour
constellations_other.description: From stenciling film frames through to the survival of Technicolor after Hollywood stopped using it, this Constellation links early cinema to some of the world's greatest films.

creator_credit_for_label: Zhi-an Zhang, Xia Rujin, Cao Juiping, Hu Jian, Liu Heng, Wenze Zhang, Yasuyoshi Tokuma, Zhang Yimou and China Film Co-Production Corporation
description: A woman married to the brutal and infertile owner of a dye mill in rural China conceives a boy with her husband’s nephew but is forced to raise her son as her husband’s heir without revealing his parentage in this circular tragedy. Filmed in glowing technicolour, this tale of romantic and familial love in the face of unbreakable tradition is more universal than its setting.
